snippet: In a speech, Prime Minister Tony Abbott, who has been in office less than two years, said he would refocus on the economy and consult more with his party colleagues.
abstract: Australian Prime Min Tony Abbott says his government will refocus its attention on the economy and will abandon unpopular policies it had tried to pursue, course correction he attributes to defeat suffered by his conservative coalition in election in Queensland.
lead_paragraph: In a speech, Prime Minister Tony Abbott, who has been in office less than two years, said he would refocus on the economy and consult more with his party colleagues.

headline.main: Australian Leader Alters Course After Losing State Vote
headline.print_headline: Australian Leader Alters Course After Losing State Vote
